snippet: The Food and Drug Administration decided doctors did not need extra instruction on prescribing some strong painkillers, despite a growing problem of abuse.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration will not require doctors to have special training before they can prescribe long-acting narcotic painkillers that can lead to addiction, but will have drug makers underwrite the cost of voluntary training.
lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration decided doctors did not need extra instruction on prescribing some strong painkillers, despite a growing problem of abuse.

headline.seo: F.D.A. Rejects Mandatory Training in Painkillers for Doctors
headline.main: F.D.A. Won’t Order Doctors to Get Pain-Drug Training
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Won’t Order Doctors to Get Pain-Drug Training
